dataset.title: Dataset: Soil carbon stocks and long-term accretion rates in tidal marshes, tidal swamps, and former tidal wetlands in eight estuaries in the Pacific Northwest, USA
dataset.abstract: We provide a dataset of 70 soil cores from estuaries in the Pacific Northwest region of the US, including from least-disturbed and restored emergent tidal marshes, forested tidal swamps, and non-tidal areas in estuarine watersheds. Data include down-core profiles of one or more soil properties: dry bulk density, organic matter content (by loss-on-ignition), carbon content (by elemental analysis), 210Pb activity, and 137Cs activity. Cores were typically sampled to about 50 cm depth using either a gouge auger or a PVC tube. Metadata associated with each core include geographic location, elevation of the wetland surface (by RTK-GNSS survey or laser leveling), dominant plant species (near the core or at the site level), and groundwater salinity (usually from a data logger time series at a station located <50 m from the coring location). Many of these cores are from the same sites where the Pacific Northwest Blue Carbon Working Group has collected greenhouse gas flux data (DOI: 10.25573/serc.27161883). Core collection and processing was funded by the NERRS Science Collaborative and the NCCOS-ESLR program of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. Data compilation was also supported by funding from the Pew Charitable Trusts.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Methods identification code unique to each study.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A half cylinder coring device in which the coring section is open, not sealed off by a fin
PVC pipe was driven into the sediment with a hammer to recover a core

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was not sieved prior to analysis for organics.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Compaction was quantified and corrected for in core based measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Time over which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: Bulk density time recorded herin is an approximate estimate
Bulk density methodology did not specify drying temperature or length, only that samples were dried to a constant mass

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Time over which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Common codes regarding loss on ignition methodology.

codeDefinition.definition: Loss on ignition time recorded herein is an approximate estimate

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction carbon was measured or estimated as a function of organic matter.

codeDefinition.definition: Fraction carbon was measured as opposed to modeled

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether or not carbonates were removed prior to calculating fraction organic carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Carbonates were not removed before measuring organic carbon

attribute.attributeDefinition: The method used to remove carbonates prior to measuring fraction carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Organic carbon fraction was measured without removing carbonates assuming carbonate content of the soil type was minimal

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of total carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any other submitter defined notes describing methodologies for determining dry bulk density, organic matter fraction, and carbon fraction.
Code indicating the method used for determining radiocesium activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining lead 210 activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the mass or accretion rate used in the excess_pb_210_model.

codeDefinition.definition: Model run as excess 210Pb against depth.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the model used to estimate accumulation rates and/or age-depth chronologies.

codeDefinition.definition: Constant initial concentration model used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the assumption used to estimate the core's supported 226Ra specific activities.

codeDefinition.definition: 226Ra was measured for each sample

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any submitter defined notes on how the age depth model was created.
Diameter of the coring device used to sample the sediment.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Site description including relevant study details and political geographic units. Some of these descriptions can be automated by the ingestion code.

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).
Indicate whether salinity_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Salinity inferred by field observation such as vegetation
Salinity was measured from a nearby groundwater well.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how salinity_class was determined.
Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants
Describes wetlands dominated by woody vegetation > 5 meters in height

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation inferred by field observation

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how vegetation_class and/or dominant species were determined.
Indicate whether elevation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Real-time kinematic GPS
Any other technique resulting in positional error < 5 cm of random error

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether elevation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Real-time kinematic GPS
Any other technique resulting in positional error < 5 cm of random error

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether elevation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Real-time kinematic GPS
Any other technique resulting in positional error < 5 cm of random error

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether elevation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Real-time kinematic GPS
Any other technique resulting in positional error < 5 cm of random error

attribute.attributeDefinition: Core identification code unique to each site.
Year of core collection.
Numeric month of year of core collection.
Numeric day of month of core collection.
Any other relevant submitter generated notes on how cores were collected.
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Accuracy of latitude and longitude measurement, if determined and recorded.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Real-time kinematic global position system (GPS)
Conventional Commercially available hand-held GPS
Any other technique resulting in positional error < 1 meter
Any other technique resulting in positional error < 30 meters

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how latitude and longitude were determined.
Surface elevation of the core relative to defined datum.

The datum relative to which the core elevation was measured against (For a complete list of datum names and aliases please refer to the ISO Geodedic Registry_https://iso.registry.bespire.eu/register/geodetic/VerticalDatum).

codeDefinition.definition: A gravity-based geodetic datum, North American Vertical Datum of 1988

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how elevation was determined.
Habitat classification of the sampled location based on description or dominate vegetation.

codeDefinition.definition: Predominantly freshwater and dominated by trees.
Wetland dominated by emergent vegetation, gramminoids or forbs.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Accretion rate according to a lead-210 based Constant Initial Concentration model.
Accretion rate parameter error according to a lead-210 based Constant Initial Concentration model.
Any notes associated with a lead-210 based Constant Initial Concentration model.
Maximum depth to which a lead-210 based Constant Initial Concentration model was applied, in centimeters depth relevant to surface.
The coefficient of determination, or R-squared value, for the lead-210 based Constatn Initial Concentration model.
Code indicating any major anthropogenic impacts historically and currently affecting the coring location.

codeDefinition.definition: No disturbance or management has occurred.
Some method of restoration (potentially unspecified) has occurred
Sampling location has experienced anthropogenic or environmental disturbance.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how inundation was determined
Project under which the samples were collected.
Three letter code used to define the estuary where sampling was conducted.
Identifier corresponding to a unique core in the Pacific Northwest Blue Carbon Working Group database.
Flag indicating how salinity was measured.

codeDefinition.definition: Salinity measurements were taken at discrete time intervals.
Salinity measurements were taken continuously via data logger.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Methods identification code unique to each study.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Sample identification unique to the core. This should be used in the case that there are relevant lab specific sample codes, or in the case that there are multiple replicate samples.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Mass of organic matter relative to sample dry mass. Ash free bulk density should not be used here but should be expressed as a loss on ignition fraction.
Mass of carbon relative to sample dry mass.
Fraction of the sample depth interval reduced due to compaction.
Any submitter generated notes on compaction.
Age of documented 137Cs Peak.
Radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for radiocesium (137Cs).
Reported unit for sample interval's Cs 137 activity measurements.
Excess radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with excess_pb210_activity.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with total_pb210_activity.
Reported unit for sample interval's Pb-210 activity measurements.
Radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for 214 Pb.
Estimated uncertainty in pb214_activity.
Reported unit for sample interval's 214 Pb activity measurements.
Any other submitter generated notes specific to the depth interval.
Identifier corresponding to a unique core in the Pacific Northwest Blue Carbon Working Group database.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Code associated with a species or a vegetation assemblage.
Notes about the vegetation recorded in relation to soil core sampling.

unit.name: countsPerSecondPerKilogram
unit.description: countrs per second per kilogram is a measure of the activity of the source of radioactivity

unit.name: nominalMonth
unit.description: one month excluding leap seconds and leap days, 2628000 seconds
